title: [K-12] AI Image Generation Tool Workshop for Landscape Design Education Applying Mathematical Principles (Geometry, Proportion, Spatial Partitioning)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic landscape design principles, smartphone proficiency, foundational geometry (shapes, angles, coordinate systems) and proportional calculation skills, and introductory trigonometric concepts
context.additional_context: A non-degree teacher training course emphasizing design thinking and the application of mathematical principles (proportion, symmetry, spatial division, trigonometry) in landscape design. Integrates math curricula (measurement, geometry, statistics) for real-world problem-solving, including AI-generated image validation.

learning_goals: Learners visualize landscape design concepts using ≥3 AI image generation tools (Adobe Firefly, Bing Image Creator, Midjourney) and apply mathematical principles like geometric patterns (fractals, tessellations) and golden ratio calculations.

Learners critically analyze AI-generated images to propose ≥2 design process applications (space optimization, material allocation) incorporating mathematical approaches such as symmetry/asymmetry analysis, coordinate system usage, etc.

Learners analyze three images generated from experiential learning activities (nature observation, 3D modeling) and design one prototype applicable to a small-scale school landscaping project (flowerbeds, walking paths). They document mathematical problem-solving processes (area calculation ≤50㎡, scale adjustment 1:10–1:50, trigonometric functions) and achieve ≥3 points ("Excellent" grade) on ≥2 of four teacher evaluation rubric items (creativity, practicality, completeness, mathematical accuracy) out of 4.

resources: AI image generation web tool access permission
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
